caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–28. Discheramocephalus spp. 25,
D. vasilii
showing aedeagus in abdomen; 26,
D. vasilii
spermatheca; 27,
D. bisulcatus
antennomeres 3–11 (hairs omitted); 28,
D. vasilii
antennomeres 3–11 (hairs omitted).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female : spermatheca
Fig. 26
. Indistinguishable in normal preparations from
bisulcatus
.

Male
: aedeagus
Fig. 25
. Large, extending into the metaventral cavity. Sperm. very long and spirally orientated (visible in the female).
Etymology. Named in honour of Vasily Grebennikov for his work on the genus and his help to the writer.

Remarks. Easily distinquished from
bisulcatus
by the larger size, presence of four longitudinal furrows on the pronotum, and by the more bulbous antennomeres 3–8 . The pronotal characters are shared by two other species of the genus, elisabethae Grebennikov and mikaeli Grebennikov. From both of these
vasilii
may be separated by the presence of the large shallow seta bearing pits on the head.

Type data.
Holotype : ♂, Andasibe N.P., Circuit Indri 2,
